title: 古池や
author: 松尾芭蕉 (1644–1694)
original:
古池や
蛙飛びこむ
水の音
ja: 古い池に、蛙がぽちゃん。静けさのなかにひとつの音。

title: I wandered lonely as a Cloud (excerpt)
author: William Wordsworth (1770–1850)
original:
I wandered lonely as a Cloud
That floats on high o'er Vales and Hills,
When all at once I saw a crowd,
A host, of golden Daffodils;
ja: 雲のようにひとり歩いていた。突然、谷や丘の上に咲く金色の水仙の群れに出会う。
en:
I wandered lonely as a cloud.
All at once I met a crowd—
a host of golden daffodils.

title: Chanson d’automne (excerpt)
author: Paul Verlaine (1844–1896)
original:
Les sanglots longs
Des violons
De l’automne
Blessent mon cœur
D’une langueur
Monotone.
ja: 秋のヴァイオリンの長い嗚咽が、単調な倦怠で私の心をかすかに痛める。
en:
The violins of autumn—long sobbing—
wound my heart with a soft, monotonous languor.

title: Because I could not stop for Death — (excerpt)
author: Emily Dickinson (1830–1886)
original:
Because I could not stop for Death –
He kindly stopped for me –
The Carriage held but just Ourselves –
And Immortality.
ja: わたしが死に立ち止まれないので、死の方がやさしく止まってくれた。馬車には、わたしたちと“不滅”だけが乗っていた。
en:
Because I could not stop for Death—
He kindly stopped for me;
The carriage held but just ourselves
And Immortality.

title: 静夜思
author: 李白 (701–762)
original:
床前明月光 疑是地上霜
举头望明月 低头思故乡
ja: 寝床の前の月光は、地面の霜のよう。頭を上げて月を見、うつむいて故郷を思う。
en:
Moonlight before my bed—
I thought it was frost on the ground.
I lift my head to the bright moon,
then lower it, thinking of home.

title: A Red, Red Rose (excerpt)
author: Robert Burns (1759–1796)
original:
O my Luve's like a red, red rose
That's newly sprung in June;
ja: きみへの愛は真紅のバラのよう、六月に咲いたばかりの。
en:
O my Luve’s like a red, red rose
That’s newly sprung in June;

title: 春望（杜甫）
author: 杜甫 (712–770)
original:
國破山河在 城春草木深
感時花濺涙 恨別鳥驚心
ja: 国は敗れても山河は在り、春の城に草木深し。世の有様を思って花に涙、別れを恨み鳥にもこころ驚く。
en:
The nation shattered, mountains and rivers remain.
Spring in the city—grasses and trees grow deep.
Moved by the times, flowers shed tears;
Hating separation, birds startle the heart.

title: Stopping by Woods on a Snowy Evening (excerpt)
author: Robert Frost (1874–1963)
original:
Whose woods these are I think I know.
His house is in the village though;
He will not see me stopping here
To watch his woods fill up with snow.
ja: だれの森か、たぶん知っている。彼の家は村の中。私がここで立ち止まり、雪に埋もれる森を見ているのを、彼は知らないだろう。
en: Whose woods these are I think I know…

title: Le Dormeur du val (excerpt)
author: Arthur Rimbaud (1854–1891)
original:
C'est un trou de verdure où chante une rivière,
Accrochant follement aux herbes des haillons
D'argent; où le soleil, de la montagne fière,
Luit: c'est un petit val qui mousse de rayons.
ja: 川の歌う緑の窪地。草にかかる銀のぼろ。山からの陽光が泡立つ小さな谷。
en:
A green hollow where a river sings,
clutching at the grasses shreds of silver;
the sun from the proud mountain gleams—
a little valley foaming with light.

title: 静かの海（俳句）
author: 与謝蕪村 (1716–1783)
original: 春の海 終日のたり のたりかな
ja: 春の海は、一日じゅう、のたりのたりとゆるやかだ。
en:
Spring sea—
all day long,
its gentle undulations.
